Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cylinder lekythos; exterior: from top, glazed black zone around shoulder; below carinated junction of shoulder and body, incised decoration consisting of long and narrow palmettes with long vertical tendrils; below palmettes, double circles in added red with black dots; below, narrow and wide black bands.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 2011,5009.132. For parallels, see British Museum 1952,0204.7 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0807) (Phase 1)
